newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares slip echoing U.S., more falls ahead.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares slip echoing U.S., more falls ahead.

text.p: Danish share prices closed lower on Thursday, hit by profit-taking, with dealers seeing more falls ahead due to weaker stock and bond markets in the United States.
"A weak Wall Street for both shares and bonds seems to point inevitably to more falls here tomorrow," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index closed 1.25 point down at 158.53, while the KFX March future fell 2.70 point to 156.40 with 342 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.
Profit-taking hit banks, Tele Danmark and Carlsberg worst.
Tele Danmark shed five crowns to close at 351, Carlsberg B six to finish at 400 crowns, while main banks Den Danske and Unidanmark both dropped four crowns to end the day at 603 and 358 respectively.
East Asiatic fell seven crowns to 152 on a 1996 result showing a 59 percent improved pre-tax profit, while Novo Nordisk put on 25 crowns to close at 705.
Sophus Berendsen continued to fall on a disappointing 1996 result for its British Rentokil unit, finishing 33 crowns down at 805.
Overall turnover for the day was 1.509 billion crowns.
